newsitem.title: USA: Texaco CEO says hopes to settle race suit.
newsitem.headline: Texaco CEO says hopes to settle race suit.

text.p: Texaco chairman and chief executive officer Peter Bijur said on Tuesday that the company was negotiating the settlement of a $71 million race discrimination suit filed against Texaco in 1994.

Bijur told reporters that Texaco expects to settle the lawsuit "as quickly as possible," but did not offer any timetable. He added that a settlement of this lawsuit is "certainly a very high priority."
Texaco shares fell 2-1/8 to 95-1/8 on Tuesday.
Bijur had earlier met with civil rights leaders Jesse Jackson and Al Sharpton, who called for a Texaco boycott and a picketing of Texaco service stations starting Saturday.
Bijur said he was disappointed at the call, saying boycotts were "divisive," and "in my view, cause economic disruption."
He said Texaco was in the midst of diversity plan that he said would outline specific goals for hiring.
"Our goal is to eradicate this kind of thinking wherever and however it is found in our company," Bijur said.
